reviews.sentence: Nice place for a relaxing getaway. Convenient location great staff nice pool area. Staff was friendly and very helpful with suggestions about activities to do in the area. Loved the platforms and cabanas in the pool areas for sunbathing and relaxing. The gym was very sparse would be nice if it had a small weight section or cable system.
internet site and reality converge. well maintained facility outgoing staff nice and clean pools and spas.
The location was pretty good and very cleanit is not a resort spa it is a hotel. The guy who checked us in was very nice. His helper. Not so much.

Pleasant stay in Palm Springs. Even though this hotel was close to a busy highway the room was quiet. The pool and hot tub were excellent. Easy access to downtown Palm Springs for all the Modernism Week events and a quick trip to other towns further down the valley. Spa with massage on site. The breakfast was quite limited with only hard boiled eggs for protein. My bed was very hard. Overall the property could use some updating.
Life is a banquet. So eat up at ivy Palm resort and spa. Every thing. Nothing.
Good but missing spa massage services. No personal no animation no spa2 hot tubs Are not a SPA. There were not even a bar.

It was a very nice get away with an excellent staff and spa service. The staff was really friendly and they were very accommodating. I especially enjoyed the Massage via the spa service. I would return again just for the professionalism and great massage therapy offered. I found out upon check out that the cost via bokingcom was twice the price it would have been if I had called and booked directly at the hotel. Not happy we paid the price of 2 nights for a 1night stay.

The staff are so accommodating and helpful here. Thank you mike and Ron. Clean rooms nice pool and spa area. The included Breakfast was good. Brand new entertainment room with lots of games and professional photo booth. They upgraded us to a suite last minute for free. Really a nice getaway. Would recommend. Shout out to the new management you ’re doing a great job.

The resort style faculty offered a game room and a great outdoor courtyard with 2 spas 2 pools and plenty of cabana and lounge space. We could have stayed longer. Great restaurants within 10 15 min walking distance and easy to find. The beds were hard really hard. But other than that it was a good experience.

Pass on the Ivy Palm. Including Resort and Spa in the name is a stretch. This feels like an 80s motel that has not been updated since being built. it is pretty shabby. The walls are thin and you can hear everything going on around you. I would not rely on the breakfast and it looked as though they have had some recent trouble with the health inspector.

I have been going to the Ivy Palm for quite some time and have always had a nice experience. The lovely gentlemen at the front desk I ca n’t remember his name was always so pleasant. This time was very different. I guess they are under new management and I am not impressed. The new “ manager ” was dismissive and spoke to me like I was a kindergartener. When I asked about their pet policy she assured me that they NEVER allowed pets. I always brought my shitzu who was more than welcome until her pasisng. The previous front desk manager even noticed she was n’t with me the first time I went there after her passing. When I asked about a per hour rate she said the NEVER do that due to their LOW rates. I assure you I have done it in the past. June rates are always lower. The lower pool had tiles missing all around the pool. The upper pool was extremely cloudy the entire weekend and it ’s not a pool I would swim in. One of the spas was the same murky and cloudy. There were police there all through the night on Saturday and a police presence in front for the majority of the morning. Did not know why. There was also a drive by gang shooting there last August in the parking lot. I was not impressed at all by the new management or the condition of the hotel. I ’m disappointed and will have to find a new “ go to ” resort. I have reservations for the Ivy Palm in July which I will be cancelling.
Terrible experience. Smells in the room and cops showed up couple times at night because of suspicious activity.

I only like the room game I did n’t like the hotel the beds the bathtub worse need to be maintenance carpet old. They have two big pools and 2 spa but what is the point to have them if one of the big pools was very dirty and the other one was kind ok. One of the spa was n’t working our main part to go there was the pools because of my kids very disappointed.

Horrific. I was booked to shoot something out in Palms desert the weekend of 419. I was traveling alone and have never been to this area so before booking a hotel room I called a few to hotels to see if I would be able to do an early check in since I arrived in the morning. I called as records show. Ivy SPA and spoke to an older woman Lois I believe. I asked if I would be able to check in sometime in the morning and gave her my time of arrival before booking the room. She said absolutely I can check in any time in the morning on 421 but she recommended booking right away since there were only few rooms left. I booked the room and headed out I am from Boston. That morning I called 15 mins before I arriving to make sure the room was okay. A man answered and said I would not be able to check in until 3 pm I had to do a video shoot at 1 even after I explained that another employee confirmed I would be able to check in hence me booking a room with that specific hotel. To make a long story short I ended up turning around missing out on a gig and also wasting money on a hotel room I never used because I was given false information. I called later that day for a third time requesting a refund and spoke to the older woman who was extremely rude and ended up having up on me. I called my bank to dispute the charge and three months later I see the Hotel has taken the refund back. I call again on 710 and speak to John the Front Desk Manager explained the situation and was told that I am pretty much lying. He was rude from the very beginning and told me He knows his staff and they would not say that and he can not do anything based on something someone else said. He then told me to go find the older woman I claim said that and talk her about the refund. Aside from their employees not knowing their own policy they are scammers and have terrible customer serve and ratings. I do not believe I should have had to pay for a room I never used especially when they approved an early check in which is the only reason why I booked. I could have simply gone to another hotel in the area. The only reason the room as canceled was because the woman on the phone during the third call told me to cancel it so someone else could use it since they were busy for coachela weekend.

Regardless of any marketing or advertising you might have seen regarding this place being upscale or remodeled this place is equivalent to an lower average Motel 6 with a good location. Do not expect any amenities beyond a pool coffee in the office. Steer clear of this place during a music festival spring break or holiday. The place attracts a younger louder crowd because it is price range location. Otherwise the Ivey Palm is fine if you are only looking for just a room. It is not a spa resort or destination. Know before you go.
Fair. I enjoyed the free parking and easy access to the rooms. The days we stayed we were told the pool would be close for two months that kind of sucked it being a resort and spa.

Staff was very friendly. Quiet place we were able to relax. Main pool and spa were under construction but we were still able to enjoy the 2nd pool. Our room however the bed was the most uncomfortable mattresses. It was very hard and uncomfortable to sleep.

The rooms were clean. If you are just going there to stay for a night or two and just using the room to sleep then it ’s okay. Kids could not enjoy much in the open swimming pool as well. The spa jacuzi was under construction. Wish we had known this then we had made the reservation. Not sure why this is called a resort and spa. Nothing great for the price we paid for room per night.

This property should be inspected and probably shut down. Not one single functioning amenity to include all pools jacuzis gym and ice machine. What was sold on your site is the opposite of what this property looks like or offers.

False advertising. It is shocking scam. Not even 1 star motelNo amenities no pool no spa not even a microwave. in the room still they call it resort and charge you like that. You can call it a junkyardOnly waste of time.
